intro: Urostigma botryapioides, commonly known as the clustered star-leaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble clusters of stars. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a waxy surface, and its flowers are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
